entry.title: Combined summary - Double-spending unconfirmed transactions is a lot easier than most people realise
entry.summary: The context revolves around the issue of double-spending in Bitcoin transactions and how it can be prevented. The author of a Reddit post conducted experiments showing how double-spending unconfirmed transactions is easier than most people realize, and provided an example of a real-world double-spend on gambling service Lucky Bit. The attack was profitable when automated and used the author's replace-by-fee patch. However, Lucky Bit added case-specific code to reject transactions with blacklisted outputs, making this particular type of double-spend no longer possible.The discussion also focuses on the challenge of preventing double-spending and how it can be addressed by moving towards a more secure network with simple rules. The need for effective countermeasures such as blacklisting and off-chain transactions is highlighted. While no complete solution has been proposed, partial solutions have been suggested that can help achieve reasonable certainty with 0-confirm transactions.The goal of miners is to maximize profits, but a network where reasonable certainty can be achieved with 0-confirm transactions is more useful, thus will result in bitcoins being more valuable. Rational miners are expected to want to collaborate to reduce the possibilities for double spend attacks as much as possible. There is a prisoner's dilemma, but do the fees from helping people successfully double-spend their coffee supplier really outweigh the increased value to the entire network - including himself - of ensuring that digital cash actually works like cash?The author also presents two possible solutions to move towards a more secure network. The difficulty lies in sending a double-spend after the original transaction. It is suggested that sending a non-standard transaction to Eligius would normally suffice, but in this particular case, it is not possible. This method defeats Andresen's proposed double-spend-relay patch as the double-spend is a non-standard transaction. The reason why sending a non-standard tx to Eligius first does not work in this scenario is not explicitly stated. However, it is questioned whether LuckyBit is connected directly to Eligius and if Eligius relays non-standard transactions.Overall, the context highlights the challenges and possible solutions in preventing double-spending in the bitcoin network.
